channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: Apache CloudStack Flaw Allows Attackers to Execute Privileged Actions
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apache CloudStack; CVE(s): CVE-2025-26521, CVE-2025-47713, CVE-2025-30675, CVE-2025-47849, CVE-2025-22829; Summary: Five critical security vulnerabilities were found in Apache CloudStack, including a privilege escalation flaw allowing Domain Admins to reset admin passwords and a vulnerability that enables attackers to impersonate the cluster creator. Upgrading to version 4.19.3.0 or 4.20.1.0 is recommended to remediate these issues.

item.title: SinoTrack GPS Devices Vulnerable to Remote Vehicle Control via Default Passwords
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SinoTrack; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5484, CVE-2025-5485; Summary: Two vulnerabilities in SinoTrack GPS devices allow an attacker to access device profiles without authorization, enabling remote functions on connected vehicles such as tracking locations and disconnecting power to the fuel pump. The flaws stem from weak authentication using a default password and a numerical identifier printed on the receiver.

item.title: How to Build a Lean Security Model: 5 Lessons from River Island
item.description: The article discusses how River Island, a UK fashion retailer, implemented a lean security model using Intruder's exposure management platform. This allowed their small team of three to improve visibility, respond faster to threats, and empower others across the business to fix vulnerabilities. The approach involves adopting continuous network monitoring, consolidating security tools, and automating vulnerability scanning and remediation processes.

item.title: HPE Aruba Network Flaw Exposes Sensitive Data to Potential Hackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: HPE Aruba Networking Private 5G Core Platform; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37100; Summary: A high-severity vulnerability in the API implementation of the Private 5G Core Platform allows unauthorized access to sensitive system files, posing a risk to enterprise confidentiality and infrastructure integrity. Exploitation can occur remotely with valid credentials or authentication to the system, enabling attackers to download protected system files containing sensitive information.

item.title: Microsoft Patches 67 Vulnerabilities Including WEBDAV Zero-Day Exploited in the Wild
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft WEBDAV; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33053; Summary: A remote code execution flaw in Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WEBDAV) has been weaponized in real-world attacks, allowing an attacker to execute malware by deceiving users into clicking on a specially crafted URL. The vulnerability, rated Critical, can be triggered by manipulating the working directory and is exploited through a .url file that launches iediagcmd.exe, which then executes another payload called Horus Loader.

item.title: Insyde UEFI Flaw Enables Digital Certificate Injection via NVRAM Variable
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Insyde H2O UEFI firmware; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4275; Summary: A critical vulnerability in the SecureFlashCertData NVRAM variable allows attackers to inject malicious digital certificates and bypass Secure Boot protections, enabling pre-boot execution of unsigned code. This flaw enables severe risks to enterprise and consumer devices, allowing for persistence across reboots and OS reinstalls.

item.title: Multiple Chrome Flaws Enable Remote Code Execution by Attackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google Chrome; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5958, CVE-2025-5959; Summary: The Stable channel of Google Chrome has been updated to version 137.0.7151.103 for Windows and Mac, and 137.0.7151.103 for Linux. Two high-severity security vulnerabilities have been addressed: a use-after-free condition in the Chrome Media component (CVE-2025-5958) that can lead to arbitrary code execution or denial-of-service attacks, and a type confusion vulnerability in the V8 JavaScript engine (CVE-2025-5959) that can be leveraged for remote code execution.

item.title: Patch Tuesday, June 2025 Edition
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33053, CVE-2025-33073; Summary: The article reports on multiple vulnerabilities in Microsoft Windows operating systems and software. One vulnerability, CVE-2025-33053, is a remote code execution flaw in the Windows implementation of WebDAV, which has already been exploited. Another vulnerability, CVE-2025-33073, is an elevation of privilege flaw in the SMB client, which can grant attackers SYSTEM-level control over a vulnerable PC.
FYSA: Several cybersecurity-relevant details are highlighted in the article, including the exploitation of a zero-day flaw and public proof-of-concept code for another flaw.

item.title: ZDI-25-332: Microsoft Windows Installer Service Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33075; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows by abusing the Windows Installer service. An attacker must first obtain low-privileged code execution on the target system to exploit this flaw, which can be used to delete arbitrary files and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-333: Microsoft Windows Installer Service Uncontrolled Search Path Element Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32714; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the Windows Installer service that uses an unsecured location.

item.title: ZDI-25-334: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Gateway Service Null Pointer Dereference Denial-of-Service Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows Remote Desktop Gateway Service; CVE(s): CVE-2025-30394; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of Microsoft Windows, without requiring authentication. The issue exists within the Remote Desktop Gateway service due to a null pointer dereference.

item.title: ZDI-25-335: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC Doc Object Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43575; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC by writing past the end of an allocated buffer. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and it can be leveraged to execute code in the context of the current process.

item.title: ZDI-25-336: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC Collab Object Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43573; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC. User interaction is required, and the flaw exists within the handling of Collab objects due to lack of validating object existence prior to operations.

item.title: ZDI-25-337: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC Font Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC; CVE(s): CVE-2025-47112; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC. User interaction is required, and the issue results from a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data that can result in a read past the end of an allocated buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-338: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC Collab Object Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43574; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC. User interaction is required, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The specific flaw exists within the handling of Collab objects and can be exploited by not validating the existence of an object prior to performing operations on it.

item.title: ZDI-25-339: JupyterLab Uncontrolled Search Path Element Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Jupyter; JupyterLab; CVE(s): CVE-2025-30167; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of JupyterLab. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability, and it is triggered only when a target user makes use of the product.

item.title: DanaBot malware operators exposed via C2 bug added in 2022
item.description: Vulnerable Product: DanaBot Malware; CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability in the DanaBot malware operation introduced in June 2022 allowed security researchers to gain insight into the malware's internal operations and the people behind it, leading to the identification, indictment, and dismantling of their operations. The "DanaBleed" flaw was a memory leak that exposed private data, including threat actor details, backend infrastructure, and victim data, for over three years.

item.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday for June 2025 — Snort rules and prominent vulnerabilities
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32710, CVE-2025-29828, CVE-2025-33071, CVE-2025-47172, CVE-2025-47162, CVE-2025-47164, CVE-2025-47167, CVE-2025-47953; Summary: The vulnerabilities affect various Microsoft Windows services and applications, including Remote Desktop Services, Schannel (Secure Channel), KDC Proxy service, Microsoft Office, and SharePoint server. They are remote code execution (RCE) or elevation of privilege vulnerabilities with varying attack complexities and exploitation likelihoods.
FYSA: None

item.title: ConnectWise rotating code signing certificates over security concerns
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise (various products); CVE(s): None; Summary: ConnectWise is rotating the digital code signing certificates used to sign ScreenConnect, Automate, and RMM executables due to concerns raised by a third-party security researcher about how certain configuration data can be abused by threat actors. The action is unrelated to any security incidents, including a nation-state cyberattack suffered last month.

item.title: New Secure Boot flaw lets attackers install bootkit malware, patch now
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3052; Summary: A Secure Boot bypass vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-3052, allows attackers with admin rights to modify a user-writable NVRAM variable and disable Secure Boot, enabling the installation of bootkit malware. The flaw affects nearly every system that trusts Microsoft's "UEFI CA 2011" certificate, which is widely used in modern systems utilizing UEFI firmware.

item.title: Microsoft Windows WebDAV 0-Day RCE Vulnerability Actively Exploited in The Wild
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33053; Summary: A critical zero-day vulnerability in Microsoft Windows allows remote code execution through manipulation of a system's working directory. The flaw was actively exploited by the advanced persistent threat (APT) group Stealth Falcon, who used it to deliver malicious files and inject shellcode into legitimate system processes.

item.title: Found in the wild: 2 Secure Boot exploits. Microsoft is patching only 1 of them.
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): None; Summary: Attackers with brief physical access to a device can boot it up in IGEL and modify the boot loader to install malware. This vulnerability allows bypassing Secure Boot protections, potentially loading an untrusted OS on systems that trust the Microsoft 3rd Party UEFI CA.

item.title: Microsoft Patch Tuesday June 2025 – 66 Vulnerabilities Patched Including 2 Zero-Day
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33053, CVE-2025-33073; Summary: A zero-day vulnerability in the WebDAV component of Windows was actively exploited and a publicly disclosed zero-day vulnerability in the SMB client allowed for elevation of privilege. The vulnerabilities could be exploited to execute arbitrary code or gain SYSTEM-level privileges, making timely patching essential.
Note: There are 66 vulnerabilities patched in total, but only these two specific vulnerabilities are mentioned as zero-days with exploitation details.

item.title: New Report Highlights the Internet as the Primary Threat to Industrial Automation Systems
item.description: According to Kaspersky ICS CERT, the internet is the primary source of threats to operational technology (OT) infrastructure worldwide, with 21.9% of Industrial Control System (ICS) computers encountering malicious objects in the first quarter of 2025. The report highlights regional disparities in cybersecurity maturity, with Africa and South-East Asia facing heightened exposure to internet-based threats.

item.title: Adobe Releases Patch Fixing 254 Vulnerabilities, Closing High-Severity Security Gaps
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Adobe; CVEs: CVE-2025-47110, CVE-2025-43585, None (for others); Summary: Adobe patched 254 security flaws in its software products, primarily affecting Experience Manager and Commerce/Magento. The vulnerabilities, including a critical reflected XSS flaw and an improper authorization issue, could lead to arbitrary code execution, privilege escalation, or security feature bypass.

item.title: ESET Details on How to Manage Your Digital Footprint
item.description: ESET highlights the importance of digital footprints, emphasizing both their benefits (personalized marketing, professional branding) and risks (privacy breaches, identity theft). The article stresses the need for robust strategies to manage and secure one's online presence, including regular audits, adjusting privacy settings, and leveraging advanced security tools.

item.title: Researchers Uncover 20+ Configuration Risks, Including Five CVEs, in Salesforce Industry Cloud
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Salesforce Industry Cloud; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43697, CVE-2025-43698, CVE-2025-43699, CVE-2025-43700, CVE-2025-43701; Summary: Over 20 configuration-related risks were found in Salesforce Industry Cloud, exposing sensitive data to unauthorized parties. The vulnerabilities allow attackers to bypass security controls and extract sensitive customer or employee information.

item.title: Windows 10 KB5060533 cumulative update released with 7 changes, fixes
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 10; CVE(s): None; Summary: The KB5060533 cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 and Windows 10 21H2 fixes seven zero-day vulnerabilities, including bringing seconds back to the time shown in the Calendar flyout, enhancing the Rich Calendar feature, and fixing issues with GDI/GDI+, Mobile Operator Profiles, and WinSaS.

item.title: SAP NetWeaver Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Escalate Privileges
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP NetWeaver Application Server AS ABAP; CVE(s): 3600840; Summary: A critical vulnerability with a CVSS score of 9.6 in the SAP NetWeaver Application Server AS ABAP's Remote Function Call (RFC) framework allows authenticated attackers to bypass standard authorization checks and escalate privileges, potentially granting access to critical system functions and data.

item.title: Microsoft June 2025 Patch Tuesday fixes exploited zero-day, 66 flaws
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): CVE-2025-33053, CVE-2025-33073; Summary: Microsoft fixed two zero-day vulnerabilities in its June 2025 Patch Tuesday updates. The first is a Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WEBDAV) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2025-33053), which was actively exploited before the patch was available. The second is a Windows SMB Client Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (CVE-2025-33073), which allows attackers to gain SYSTEM privileges on vulnerable devices.

item.title: Windows 11 KB5060842 and KB5060999 cumulative updates released
item.description: This article discusses the release of Windows 11 KB5060842 and KB5060999 cumulative updates for versions 24H2 and 23H2, which include fixes for 66 security vulnerabilities. The updates also introduce new features such as improved Windows Search, enhanced digital accessibility with AI-powered image descriptions in Narrator, and management of Energy Saver settings through group policies and MDM configurations using Microsoft Intune.

item.title: Beware of Instagram Growth Tools Stealing Login Credentials and Sending Them to Attackers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: imad213 (Python package); CVE(s): None; Summary: The malicious Python package imad213, posing as an Instagram growth tool, tricks users into surrendering their credentials. Upon execution, it initiates a remote check and prompts users for their Instagram login details, saving them locally in plaintext. The malware then broadcasts these credentials to a network of Turkish bot services, which pose as legitimate platforms with professional interfaces.

item.title: North Korean APT Hackers Target Users on Social Media to Spread Malware
item.description: This article reports a highly sophisticated Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) campaign orchestrated by the North Korean state-sponsored hacking group Kimsuky, targeting individuals in South Korea through social media, email, and Telegram. The attackers use social engineering and tailored content to exploit trust, and employ a multi-stage infiltration strategy involving malicious files, decoy PDFs, and malware designed to bypass signature-based detection tools.

item.title: FIN6 Uses AWS-Hosted Fake Resumes on LinkedIn to Deliver More_eggs Malware
item.description: FIN6 is a financially motivated threat actor that uses fake resumes hosted on Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure to deliver the More_eggs malware. The group initiates contact with recruiters through LinkedIn and Indeed, posing as job seekers, and then delivers phishing messages that lead to malware.

item.title: Microsoft Outlook to block more risky attachments used in attacks
item.description: Microsoft will block .library-ms and .search-ms file types in Outlook Web and the new Outlook for Windows starting next month to enhance security and prevent exploitation of Windows vulnerabilities. The blocked file types are rarely used, but may affect organizations that rely on them.

item.title: Texas Dept. of Transportation breached, 300k crash records stolen
item.description: The Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT) suffered a data breach after a threat actor downloaded 300,000 crash records from its database using compromised credentials. The exposed data includes full names, physical addresses, driver's license numbers, and other information, which elevates the risk for social engineering, scamming, and phishing attacks.

item.title: FIN6 hackers pose as job seekers to backdoor recruiters’ devices
item.description: FIN6 hacking group impersonates job seekers to target recruiters, using social engineering campaigns to deliver "More Eggs" malware-as-a-service JavaScript backdoor for credential theft, system access, and ransomware deployment.

item.title: Ivanti Workspace Control hardcoded key flaws expose SQL credentials
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC); CVE(s): CVE-2025-5353, CVE-2025-22455, CVE-2025-22463; Summary: The IWC solution has three high-severity hardcoded key vulnerabilities that can lead to privilege escalation and system compromise following successful exploitation. Two flaws allow local authenticated attackers to decrypt stored SQL credentials, while the third enables decryption of the stored environment password.

item.title: Massive Heroku outage impacts web platforms worldwide
item.description: Heroku is experiencing a widespread outage that has lasted over six hours, affecting developers' ability to log in and use the platform. The outage impacts various services and websites, including SolarWinds, which cannot ingest logs due to the issue. Heroku has not yet provided details on the root cause or when services will be restored.

item.title: Ivanti Workspace Control Vulnerability Lets Attackers Remotely Exploit To Steal the Credential
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ivanti Workspace Control; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5353, CVE-2025-22463, CVE-2025-22455; Summary: The vulnerabilities in Ivanti Workspace Control prior to 10.19.10.0 allow local authenticated attackers to decrypt stored SQL credentials and environment passwords due to hardcoded cryptographic keys. Successful exploitation could lead to severe consequences, including unauthorized access to critical systems.

item.title: Rust-based Myth Stealer Malware Spread via Fake Gaming Sites Targets Chrome, Firefox Users
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various; CVE(s): None; Summary: Myth Stealer is a Rust-based information stealer that steals passwords, cookies, and autofill information from Chromium- and Gecko-based browsers. It's distributed through fake gaming websites and online forums, and attempts to terminate running processes associated with web browsers before exfiltrating stolen data to a remote server or Discord webhook. The malware contains anti-analysis techniques such as string obfuscation and system checks using filenames and usernames.

item.title: AI is a data-breach time bomb, reveals new report
item.description:
The article discusses the risks associated with AI, cloud environments, and SaaS apps. It highlights that 99% of organizations have sensitive data unnecessarily exposed to AI tools, and no organization was fully prepared for AI. The report emphasizes the importance of implementing effective security measures to prioritize data protection.
Note: There are no specific vulnerabilities mentioned in this article, but it focuses on the risks associated with AI and data exposure.

item.title: Hackers Persist in Using ConnectWise ScreenConnect Tool to Distribute Malware
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ConnectWise ScreenConnect; CVE(s): None; Summary: Hackers are exploiting a vulnerability in ScreenConnect versions 23.9.7 and prior, deploying malicious payloads, particularly targeting financial organizations, using phishing emails with invoice themes to trick users into downloading harmful executables. The exploitation involves signed malicious droppers, likely tied to the CHAINVERB backdoor associated with the UNC5952 threat group.

item.title: OpenAI working to fix ChatGPT outage affecting users worldwide
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; FYSA: The article reports on an ongoing outage impacting OpenAI's ChatGPT, causing errors and latency for users worldwide. The issue has been identified as a root cause and the company is working to implement a mitigation.

item.title: Severe SAP NetWeaver Vulnerability Allows Attackers to Bypass Authorization Checks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP; CVE(s): 3600840 (9.6), 3609271 (8.8), 3606484 (8.5), 3560693 (8.2), 3610006 (7.5), 3590887 (5.8); Summary: The June Patch Day from SAP addresses nineteen security patches, including critical vulnerabilities that can allow attackers to bypass authorization controls and escalate privileges across multiple enterprise systems. The most severe vulnerability affects the RFC framework in SAP NetWeaver Application Server AS ABAP, enabling authenticated attackers to bypass standard authorization controls and achieve privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2025-49113: Critical Roundcube Vulnerability Enables RCE Exploitation
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Roundcube; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49113; Summary: A critical Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-49113, affects all Roundcube versions before 1.5.10 and 1.6.x up to 1.6.10, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary commands on targeted systems after successful authentication.

item.title: New SharePoint Phishing Campaigns Employing Deceptive Lick Techniques
item.description: Phishing campaigns leveraging Microsoft SharePoint to bypass modern detection systems have been identified, exploiting inherent trust users place in the platform. These attacks disguise phishing URLs as legitimate file-sharing links, tricking users into accessing credential-harvesting pages or downloading malware, and evade endpoint detection and response (EDR) tools and email security gateways.

item.title: ISPConfig Vulnerability Allows Privilege Escalation to Superadmin and PHP Code Injection Exploit
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ISPConfig version 3.2.12p1; CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerability allows authenticated attackers to escalate their privileges to that of a superadmin and execute arbitrary PHP code remotely, posing a serious risk to affected systems. Attackers can manipulate HTTP parameters when using the client_add and users_edit features, creating a client account with admin privileges, then modifying or assuming the identity of the superadmin user (ID 1), granting unrestricted access to the ISPConfig instance.

item.title: Critical Vulnerability in Lovable’s Security Policies Allows Malicious Code Injection
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Lovable; CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerability affects Lovable's AI-powered development platform, exposing sensitive user data and enabling malicious code injection across hundreds of applications. It stems from the platform's client-driven architecture and lack of proper Row Level Security (RLS) configurations, allowing unauthorized access to database contents.

item.title: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Multiple; CVE(s): CVE-2025-24016, CVE-2025-33053; Summary: Two new vulnerabilities were added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog by CISA due to evidence of active exploitation. The vulnerabilities are a Wazuh Server Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability and a Web Distributed Authoring and Versioning (WebDAV) External Control of File Name or Path vulnerability. These types of vulnerabilities pose significant risks to the federal enterprise and all organizations are urged to prioritize timely remediation.

item.title: SinoTrack GPS Receiver
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SinoTrack Equipment; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5484, CVE-2025-5485; Summary: Weak authentication and observable response discrepancy vulnerabilities in all known SinoTrack devices allow an attacker to access device profiles without authorization through the common web management interface, enabling remote functions on connected vehicles.

item.title: CISA Releases Four Industrial Control Systems Advisories
item.description: The article discusses the release of four Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories by CISA, providing information on current security issues, vulnerabilities, and exploits surrounding ICS.

item.title: Hitachi Energy Relion 670, 650, SAM600-IO Series
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hitachi Energy Relion 670, Relion 650, SAM600-IO Series; CVE(s): CVE-2022-4304; Summary: A timing-based side channel exists in the OpenSSL RSA decryption implementation, allowing an attacker to decrypt application data in transit by sending a large number of trial messages for decryption. This vulnerability affects all RSA padding modes: PKCS#1 v1.5, RSA-OEAP and RSASVE.

item.title: MicroDicom DICOM Viewer
item.description: Vulnerable Product: MicroDicom DICOM Viewer; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5943; Summary: The DICOM Viewer suffers from an out-of-bounds write vulnerability, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code with user interaction. Successful exploitation could lead to the execution of arbitrary code on affected installations.

item.title: Five plead guilty to laundering $36 million stolen in investment scams
item.description: Five men from China, the United States, and Turkey pleaded guilty to their involvement in an international crime ring and laundering nearly $37 million stolen from U.S. victims in cryptocurrency investment scams carried out from Cambodia. The scam involved accomplices reaching out to targets via unsolicited social media, phone calls, text messages, and online dating services to gain their trust, promoting fraudulent digital asset investments and falsely claiming that the victims' funds' value increased after they tricked them into investing, when, in fact, their money was stolen.

item.title: The Hidden Threat in Your Stack: Why Non-Human Identity Management is the Next Cybersecurity Frontier
item.description: Non-human identities (NHIs), including application secrets, API keys, service accounts, and OAuth tokens, have increased in recent years due to the expanding array of apps and services. NHIs introduce unique risks and management challenges that security leaders must address.

item.title: CISA Issues Alert on Erlang/OTP SSH Server RCE Vulnerability Under Active Exploitation
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Erlang/OTP SSH server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32433; Summary: The Erlang/OTP SSH server implementation has a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-32433) that allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands without authentication, bypassing standard security controls. This flaw enables unauthenticated remote code execution and is actively exploited in the wild, posing significant risks to organizations worldwide.

item.title: Indian Authorities Bust Cybercriminals Posing as Microsoft Tech Support
item.description: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) launched an operation targeting a tech support scam network impersonating Microsoft, resulting in the arrest of six key operatives and the shutdown of two illicit call centers. The operation was a result of international collaboration between the CBI, Japan's Cybercrime Control Center, National Police Agency, and Microsoft's Digital Crimes Unit.

item.title: Malicious Actors Exploit SoraAI’s Popularity & GitHub to Distribute Malware
item.description: The article describes a malware campaign that uses OpenAI's Sora video generation model as a social engineering tactic to distribute information-stealing malware. The attack chain involves multiple stages, including downloading malicious batch files and executing Python scripts, which target sensitive data such as browser cookies, passwords, and system information.

item.title: Researcher Found Flaw to Discover Phone Numbers Linked to Any Google Account
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google; CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability in Google's account recovery feature allowed attackers to brute-force a user's recovery phone number, potentially exposing their accounts to privacy and security risks. The exploit required several steps, including leaking the display name via Looker Studio, running the forgot password flow, and brute-forcing the phone number against the username recovery endpoint.

item.title: The Evolution of Linux Binaries in Targeted Cloud Operations
item.description: Unit 42 researchers have identified a growing threat to cloud security: Linux Executable and Linkage Format (ELF) files that threat actors are developing to target cloud infrastructure. The article highlights the types of malicious binaries that threat actors are developing for use in attacks against Linux-based environments, including backdoors, droppers, remote access Trojans (RATs), data wipers, and vulnerability-exploiting binaries.

item.title: Malware Deployment Campaigns: ‘Librarian Ghouls’ APT Group Targets Organizations
item.description: The Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group "Librarian Ghouls" has been actively targeting organizations across Russia and the CIS with sophisticated malware deployment campaigns, utilizing targeted phishing emails as their primary infection vector. They employ legitimate third-party software to mask their activities and hinder detection, deploying remote access tools, stealing sensitive credentials, and installing crypto-mining malware like XMRig on compromised systems.

item.title: SAP Security Patch Day: 14 Vulnerabilities Resolved Across Various Products
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SAP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-42989 (Critical), CVE-2025-42982 (High), CVE-2025-23192 (High), CVE-2025-42977 (Medium), CVE-2025-42994, CVE-2025-42995, and CVE-2025-42996 (Medium); Summary: SAP's June 10, 2025 Security Patch Day addressed 14 vulnerabilities across the enterprise software portfolio, including a Critical vulnerability in SAP NetWeaver Application Server for ABAP allowing unauthorized access to sensitive system functions.

item.title: Exploitation of Critical Wazuh Server RCE Vulnerability Leads to Mirai Variant Deployment
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Wazuh; CVE(s): CVE-2025-24016, CVE-2023-1389 (TP-Link Archer AX21), CVE-2017-17215 (Huawei HG532); Summary: A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Wazuh servers, identified as CVE-2025-24016 with a CVSS score of 9.9, allows attackers to execute arbitrary Python code via maliciously crafted JSON payloads. The vulnerability has been weaponized by two distinct botnets to propagate variants of the notorious Mirai malware, targeting primarily Internet of Things (IoT) devices.

item.title: Fusion Stealer Rises, Android 0-Day for Sale, EDF Leak Exposed
item.description: The article highlights several concerning cybercriminal offerings on the dark web, including an alleged Android 0-day exploit, a stealer tool called Fusion Stealer, unauthorized VPN access to a US healthcare provider, admin panel access for multiple South American FinTech companies, and a massive alleged leak of EDF Energy's customer database. These discoveries emphasize the persistent and evolving threat landscape facing organizations and individuals worldwide.

item.title: Sensata Technologies Faces Disruption Due to Ransomware Attack
item.description: The article reports a significant cybersecurity incident at Sensata Technologies, involving an external system breach that compromised personal information of hundreds of individuals. The breach remained undetected for nearly two months before being discovered on May 23, 2025.

item.title: Vulnerability in DanaBot Malware C2 Server Leaks Threat Actor Usernames and Crypto Keys
item.description: A severe vulnerability in the command-and-control (C2) infrastructure of the DanaBot malware has been discovered, allowing for the exposure of usernames and cryptographic keys used by malicious operators. This breach could provide cybersecurity defenders with a rare glimpse into the inner workings of DanaBot operations and enable more effective disruption of this persistent banking trojan.

item.title: Over 84,000 Roundcube Webmail Installations Exposed to Remote Code Vulnerabilities
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Roundcube Webmail; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49113; Summary: The critical vulnerability, designated as CVE-2025-49113, allows authenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code remotely. It affects all Roundcube versions from 1.1.0 through 1.6.10 and has been exploited in targeted attacks, potentially conducted by state actors.

item.title: Rare Werewolf APT Uses Legitimate Software in Attacks on Hundreds of Russian Enterprises
item.description: Rare Werewolf, an advanced persistent threat (APT) group, has been linked to a series of cyber attacks targeting Russia and CIS countries. The attacks aim to establish remote access to compromised hosts, steal credentials, and deploy the XMRig cryptocurrency miner. The group obtains initial access using phishing emails and leverages legitimate software to interact with infected systems, harvest passwords, and disable antivirus software.

item.title: ManageEngine Exchange Reporter Plus Vulnerability Enables Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: ManageEngine Exchange Reporter Plus; CVE(s): CVE-2025-3835; Summary: The vulnerability, affecting all builds up to version 5721, allows attackers to execute arbitrary commands on target servers, enabling remote code execution and potentially compromising system integrity. Successful exploitation could grant attackers complete control over the compromised system, enabling data breaches, regulatory compliance violations, and operational disruptions.

item.title: CISA Adds Erlang SSH and Roundcube Flaws to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Erlang/Open Telecom Platform (OTP); CVE(s): CVE-2025-32433; Summary: A missing authentication vulnerability in OTP SSH server allows an attacker to execute arbitrary commands without valid credentials, potentially leading to unauthenticated remote code execution. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 10.0 and was fixed in April 2025.
Vulnerable Product: Roundcube Webmail; CVE(s): CVE-2024-42009; Summary: A cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in RoundCube Webmail allows a remote attacker to steal and send emails of a victim via a crafted email message by taking advantage of a desanitization issue. The vulnerability has a CVSS score of 9.3 and was fixed in August 2024.
FYSA: The article also mentions an unpatched account takeover vulnerability (CVE-2025-31022, CVSS score: 9.8) in the PayU CommercePro plugin for WordPress that enables an attacker to seize control of any user without authentication, with serious consequences if exploited successfully.

item.title: Google Vulnerability Allowed Hackers to Access User Phone Numbers
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google account recovery system; CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerability allowed attackers to brute-force and obtain the phone numbers of any Google user by exploiting Google's username recovery form that still functioned without JavaScript, bypassing modern security protections. The attack leveraged two HTTP requests and exploited IP-based rate limiting and CAPTCHA challenges.

item.title: Stolen Ticketmaster data from Snowflake attacks briefly for sale again
item.description: The article discusses the Arkana Security extortion gang listing Ticketmaster data for sale, which was previously stolen during the 2024 Snowflake data theft attacks. It appears that the group is attempting to resell old stolen data, rather than conducting a new breach. The article also mentions the ShinyHunters group's involvement in various breaches and their potential ties to law enforcement arrests.

item.title: Over 84,000 Roundcube instances vulnerable to actively exploited flaw
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Roundcube; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49113; Summary: The Roundcube webmail installation is vulnerable to a critical remote code execution (RCE) flaw, patched on June 1, 2025. The vulnerability stems from unsanitized $_GET['_from'] input, enabling PHP object deserialization and session corruption when session keys begin with an exclamation mark. Exploitation requires authentication, but attackers claim valid credentials can be obtained via CSRF, log scraping, or brute-forced.

item.title: Google patched bug leaking phone numbers tied to accounts
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Google; CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability allowed researchers to brute-force any Google account's recovery phone number by knowing the profile name and a partial phone number. The attack exploited a deprecated JavaScript-disabled version of the Google username recovery form, which lacked modern anti-abuse protections.

item.title: SentinelOne shares new details on China-linked breach attempt
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Ivanti Cloud Service Appliances, Check Point gateways; CVE(s): None; Summary: The vulnerabilities in exposed network devices were exploited by Chinese hackers in an attempted supply chain attack on SentinelOne.

item.title: Linux Foundation unveils decentralized WordPress plugin manager
item.description: The article discusses the launch of FAIR Package Manager, an independent distribution system for trusted WordPress plugins and themes. This move is a response to controversy between Automattic (WordPress.com) and WP Engine over plugin updates. The FAIR Package Manager aims to decentralize the ecosystem, bringing control back to developers and hosts, while improving security features such as cryptographic measures, browser compatibility checking, and reliance on trusted source security salts.

item.title: New Report Reveals Chinese Hackers Attempted to Breach SentinelOne Servers
item.description: The article discusses SentinelLABS, a reconnaissance operation targeting SentinelOne, a leading cybersecurity vendor. The operation was linked to China-nexus threat actors and affected over 70 organizations worldwide. Despite the persistent efforts, SentinelOne's infrastructure remained uncompromised due to robust monitoring and rapid response mechanisms.

item.title: Sensata Technologies says personal data stolen by ransomware gang
item.description: Sensata Technologies suffered a data breach after an April ransomware attack, affecting current and former employees and their dependents. The stolen data includes full name, address, Social Security Number (SSN), driver's license number, state ID card number, passport number, financial account information, payment card information, medical information, health insurance information, and date of birth.

item.title: Bitter Malware Employs Custom-Built Tools to Evade Detection in Advanced Attacks
item.description: This article discusses the malware arsenal of the Bitter group (TA397), a state-backed actor aligned with India's interests. The group has evolved from deploying rudimentary downloaders to sophisticated RATs and backdoors, showcasing technical prowess and adaptability.

item.title: Over 70 Organizations Across Multiple Sectors Targeted by China-Linked Cyber Espionage Group
item.description: The article discusses a series of cyberattacks attributed to China-nexus threat actors, targeting various organizations across different sectors. The attacks are believed to be part of a broader campaign, with some connections to previously reported APT15 and UNC5174 groups.

item.title: Skitnet Malware Actively Adopted by Ransomware Gangs to Enhance Operational Efficiency
item.description: Skitnet malware (also known as Bossnet) is a post-exploitation package with an integrated server-side control panel that has emerged as a critical tool for ransomware gangs, showcasing increased operational efficiency for cybercriminals. It initiates its infection chain through social engineering tactics and uses various techniques to evade detection, including DLL hijacking, dynamic API resolution, and anti-forensic measures.

item.title: Google Warns of Surge in Cyberattacks Targeting US Users to Steal Login Credentials
item.description: The article highlights a significant increase in cyberattacks and scams targeting US consumers, with a focus on stealing login credentials. Scammers are leveraging text messages and email as attack vectors, and users are increasingly relying on modern authentication methods like passkeys and social sign-ins to stay secure. Google is actively combating these threats through AI-driven security features, including blocking over 99.9% of spam, phishing, and malware in Gmail.

item.title: Two Distinct Botnets Exploit Wazuh Server Vulnerability to Launch Mirai-Based Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Wazur Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-24016; Summary: A critical security flaw (CVE-2025-24016) in the Wazuh server allows remote code execution, and has been exploited by threat actors to drop Mirai botnet variants and conduct DDoS attacks. The vulnerability was patched in February 2025, but attempts at exploitation were detected as early as March and May 2025.

item.title: Meta Bypassed Privacy Protections to Track Android Users
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Meta (formerly Facebook) and Yandex; CVE(s): None; Summary: Meta and Yandex exploited a design feature of Android's localhost ports to track users' web activity and link it to their real identities. The tracking technique, which bypasses typical privacy protections, allows apps to receive browser metadata and cookies, enabling the creation of a persistent profile of a user's browsing habits.

item.title: U.S. Targets $7.7M in Crypto Tied to North Korean IT Worker Scam
item.description: The United States Department of Justice has seized over $7.7 million in cryptocurrency and digital assets linked to a sophisticated global laundering operation orchestrated by North Korea. The operation involved the use of falsified identities, virtual private networks (VPNs), and advanced obfuscation techniques to conceal the origin of the funds.

item.title: APT41 Hackers Leverage Google Calendar for Malware C2 in Attacks on Government Entities
item.description: This article describes an APT41 campaign that uses Google Calendar as a command-and-control (C2) mechanism to exfiltrate information and retrieve commands from attackers. The malware, named ToughProgress, employs advanced obfuscation techniques, process hollowing, and driver-like handling to achieve persistence and privilege escalation.

item.title: Designing Blue Team playbooks with Wazuh for proactive incident response
item.description: This article discusses Blue Team playbooks, which are detailed guides outlining how to identify, contain, and remediate specific security incidents. The article highlights the importance of structured processes in incident response and mentions Wazuh, an open-source security platform that provides real-time threat detection, automated response, and comprehensive incident management capabilities.

item.title: Designing Blue Team playbooks with Wazuh for proactive cyber defense
item.description: This article discusses Blue Team playbooks, which are detailed guides outlining how to identify, contain, and remediate specific security incidents. The article highlights the importance of structured processes in incident response and introduces Wazuh, an open-source security platform that provides real-time threat detection, automated response, and comprehensive incident management for various attack scenarios.

item.title: New Blitz Malware Targets Windows Servers to Deploy Monero Miner
item.description: The Blitz malware is a Windows-based malware that deploys a Monero cryptocurrency miner, information-stealer, and DoS capability. It spreads through backdoored game cheats for the popular mobile game Standoff 2 and communicates via a REST API built on the FastAPI framework.

item.title: OpenAI Shuts Down ChatGPT Accounts Linked to Russian, Iranian & Chinese Cyber
item.description: The article discusses the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in cybersecurity, highlighting its potential to detect and mitigate various threats such as social engineering campaigns, cyber espionage operations, scams, and spam. The organization uses AI-driven tools to analyze vast datasets, flag anomalies, and identify suspicious behaviors, with a focus on countering authoritarian regimes, child exploitation, and malicious cyber activity.

item.title: Hackers Deploy FormBook Malware via Weaponized Excel Files to Target Windows Systems
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Office; CVE(s): CVE-2017-0199; Summary: A critical phishing campaign targets Windows users by exploiting a long-standing vulnerability in older versions of Microsoft Office (Office 2007/2010/2013/2016) using malicious Excel attachments. The exploit triggers an HTTP request to download additional payloads, ultimately unleashing the FormBook malware, which steals sensitive information and poses a severe threat to victims' devices.

item.title: Over 1,000 Employees Departed CISA Since Trump Administration Began
item.description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has lost nearly one-third of its workforce since the start of the Trump administration, with approximately 1,000 employees leaving due to buyouts, early retirements, and layoffs. This reduction in staff coincides with a proposed 17% to 30% reduction in CISA's budget, targeting critical programs such as continuous diagnostics and monitoring (CDM) tools and CyberSentry. The departures and funding cuts threaten the agency's ability to fulfill its core mission of defending federal networks, supporting critical infrastructure operators, and responding to cyber incidents.

item.title: Grocery wholesale giant United Natural Foods hit by cyberattack
item.description: UNFI, North America's largest publicly traded wholesale distributor, was forced to shut down some systems following a recent cyberattack. The company reported $31 billion in annual revenues and has over 28,000 workers. An investigation is ongoing with the assistance of external cybersecurity experts, but no details have been released on the nature of the attack or whether data was stolen.

item.title: Seraphic Security UnveilsBrowserTotal™ – Free AI-PoweredBrowser Security Assessment For Enterprises
item.description: Seraphic Security announces the launch of BrowserTotal, a browser security assessment tool that conducts over 120 tests to provide posture standing, emerging threat insights, and more. The platform is powered by AI and offers CISOs and security teams a comprehensive environment to test browser security defenses against today's most sophisticated threats.

item.title: Kettering Health Confirms Interlock Ransomware Breach and Data Theft
item.description: The article discusses a ransomware attack on Kettering Health, a major Ohio-based healthcare provider, which resulted in unauthorized access to the network, encryption of critical patient care systems, and exfiltration of sensitive patient data. The incident highlights the importance of robust cybersecurity frameworks, rapid incident response, and transparent communication with patients and staff.

item.title: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Erlang/OTP SSH Server, RoundCube Webmail; CVE(s): CVE-2025-32433, CVE-2024-42009; Summary: The two vulnerabilities added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog are a missing authentication for critical function vulnerability in Erlang/OTP SSH Server and a cross-site scripting vulnerability in RoundCube Webmail. These vulnerabilities pose significant risks to the federal enterprise and can be exploited by malicious cyber actors.

item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: Chrome 0-Day, Data Wipers, Misused Tools and Zero-Click iPhone Attacks
item.description:
FYSA:
The article appears to be a collection of cybersecurity-related news and updates from various sources. It covers a wide range of topics, including malware attacks, APT groups, and government efforts to combat cybercrime.
Some of the specific stories mentioned in the article include:
1. The alleged involvement of Taiwan's Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) in sponsoring five advanced persistent threat (APT) groups. 2. China accusing Taiwan of running these APT groups with US help, and issuing warrants for 20 Taiwanese people involved. 3. Colombian cybercriminals linked to vehicle insurance scams that use fake websites and ads on Facebook to deceive users. 4. The takedown of TrickBot, a notorious ransomware gang, by German authorities. 5. Microsoft Defender's Attack Surface Reduction (ASR) rules and how they can be enabled to block common malware techniques.
Overall, the article highlights the ongoing threat of cybercrime and the importance of staying vigilant in order to prevent attacks.

item.title: Multiple QNAP Flaws Allow Remote Attackers to Hijack User Accounts
item.description: Vulnerable Product: QNAP Qsync Central; CVE(s): CVE-2025-22482, CVE-2025-29892; Summary: Two critical vulnerabilities were found in Qsync Central, a file synchronization software used by QNAP NAS devices. The first vulnerability is a format string vulnerability that can allow attackers to obtain sensitive data or execute malicious code, while the second is an SQL injection vulnerability that can also lead to arbitrary code execution or command injection. Both require user-level access to exploit, but the impact is severe and prompt patching is essential.

item.title: Think Your IdP or CASB Covers Shadow IT? These 5 Risks Prove Otherwise
item.description: The article discusses "shadow IT," which refers to unsanctioned software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications, dormant accounts, unmanaged identities, over-permissioned SaaS tools, and orphaned access that can be used by attackers to gain unauthorized access to enterprise systems. The risks include OAuth sprawl, shadow admins, GenAI access, and apps created directly in platforms like Google Workspace or Slack.

item.title: New DuplexSpy RAT Gives Attackers Full Control Over Windows Machines
item.description: DuplexSpy is a Remote Access Trojan (RAT) that poses a significant threat to Windows-based systems. It offers attackers unprecedented control over compromised machines, featuring persistence mechanisms, stealthy execution, and surveillance tools. Its open-source nature and customization options make it a potent weapon in the hands of malicious actors.

item.title: Jenkins Gatling Plugin Flaw Allows CSP Bypass, Exposing Systems to Attack
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Jenkins Gatling Plugin; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5806; Summary: The Gatling Plugin in Jenkins allows for across-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities due to a bypass of Content-Security-Policy protections, enabling attackers with low-privileged access to inject malicious scripts that can execute in other users' browsers, leading to theft of sensitive session cookies and unauthorized actions.

item.title: Roles Here? Roles There? Roles Anywhere: Exploring the Security of AWS IAM Roles Anywhere
item.description: The article discusses the AWS IAM Roles Anywhere service, which enables external workloads to authenticate using X.509 digital certificates. The service allows organizations to securely access cloud APIs and can be used with Kubernetes pods or other external workloads. However, if not configured correctly, default configurations of this service can be exploited by attackers, allowing them to gain access to additional roles in the AWS account.

item.title: Beware for Developers: 16 React Native Packages with Millions of Downloads Compromised Overnight
item.description: Vulnerable Product: npm ecosystem; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article reports a large-scale attack targeting the npm ecosystem, compromising 16 popular React Native packages with over one million weekly downloads. The attack injected malicious payloads into widely used libraries, posing an immediate risk to developers and organizations relying on these dependencies.

item.title: Australian Naval Operations Accidentally Jam New Zealand’s Internet and Radio
item.description: The article describes a widespread outage of wireless internet and radio services in New Zealand caused by HMAS Canberra's advanced navigation radar system interfering with civilian devices operating on the 5 GHz band. The incident highlights the fragility of the shared spectrum environment, particularly for rural and regional communities dependent on fixed wireless broadband.

item.title: Malicious npm Utility Packages Enable Attackers to Wipe Production Systems
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: Two malicious npm packages (express-api-sync and system-health-sync-api) were discovered by Socket's Threat Research Team. The packages, designed to masquerade as legitimate utilities, embed destructive backdoors that can annihilate production systems.

item.title: HelloTDS Malware Spread via FakeCaptcha Infrastructure Infects Millions of Devices
item.description: The HelloTDS (Traffic Direction System) infrastructure has been uncovered, delivering malicious campaigns to millions of users worldwide. It employs advanced fingerprinting techniques and social engineering to selectively target victims, infecting over 4.3 million devices in April and May 2025 alone.

item.title: Critical Salesforce Vulnerability Exposes Global Users to SOQL Injection Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Salesforce Aura controller; CVE(s): None; Summary: A critical SOQL injection vulnerability was discovered in a default Salesforce Aura controller, affecting potentially thousands of deployments and millions of user records. The vulnerability allowed for the extraction of sensitive data, such as user emails, names, addresses, and even password hashes, depending on the configuration.

item.title: OpenAI Bans ChatGPT Accounts Used by Russian, Iranian and Chinese Hacker Groups
item.description: This article reports on multiple threat actors using ChatGPT accounts to develop malware, automate social media posts, research satellite communications technologies, and engage in other malicious activities. The account holders used temporary email addresses to sign up for ChatGPT, fine-tuned their code, and distributed AI-assisted malware through a publicly available code repository.

item.title: Kali GPT – Revolutionizing Penetration Testing with AI on Kali Linux
item.description: Kali GPT is an AI assistant specifically designed for the Kali Linux ecosystem, aimed at streamlining workflows, providing real-time insights, and automating capabilities for cybersecurity professionals. It uses natural language processing (NLP) to interact with users, offering contextual help, suggesting exploits or defensive measures, and generating technical instructions.

item.title: Kimsuky Strikes Again – Coordinated Attacks Target Facebook, Email, and Telegram
item.description: Kimsuky, a North Korea-aligned advanced persistent threat (APT) group, has been conducting a sophisticated cyber espionage campaign called "AppleSeed" since March to April 2025. The campaign targeted defense sector organizations, North Korea-related activists, and cryptocurrency exchanges, using social engineering and technical subterfuge.

item.title: New Mirai botnet infect TBK DVR devices via command injection flaw
item.description: Vulnerable Product: TBK Vision DVR-4104 and DVR-4216; CVE(s): CVE-2024-3721; Summary: A command injection vulnerability (CVE-2024-3721) in TBK Vision's DVR-4104 and DVR-4216 digital video recording devices allows attackers to hijack devices using a specially crafted POST request. The exploit is being used by a new Mirai botnet variant to drop an ARM32 malware binary, which establishes communication with a command and control (C2) server to enlist the device in the botnet.

item.title: New Supply Chain Malware Operation Hits npm and PyPI Ecosystems, Targeting Millions Globally
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: GlueStack packages; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article reports a supply chain attack targeting over a dozen packages associated with GlueStack, delivering malware that allows attackers to run shell commands, take screenshots, and upload files to infected machines. The impacted packages collectively account for nearly 1 million weekly downloads.
FYSA: This report highlights the emergence of threat actors focusing on system sabotage rather than financial gains, and their use of bogus libraries for information theft and credential harvesting. It also shows that attackers are leveraging email as a covert communication channel to blend in with legitimate application emails.

item.title: Cybercriminals turn to “residential proxy” services to hide malicious traffic
item.description: Attackers have been increasingly using residential networks to mask their malicious activity, making it harder for organizations and law enforcement to detect and track suspicious traffic. This tactic uses decentralized platforms running on consumer hardware to reduce insight and control, allowing criminal actors to operate undetected.

item.title: Malicious Browser Extensions Infect 722 Users Across Latin America Since Early 2025
item.description: Vulnerable Product: GAS Tecnologia Warsaw; CVE(s): None; Summary: A malicious browser extension for Chromium-based web browsers was detected in a campaign targeting Brazilian users, allowing attackers to siphon user authentication data and potentially display loading screens or serve malicious QR codes on the bank's web page.

item.title: Supply chain attack hits Gluestack NPM packages with 960K weekly downloads
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Gluestack "react-native-aria" packages; CVE(s): None; Summary: A significant supply chain attack compromised 16 popular Gluestack packages on NPM, including over 950,000 weekly downloads. The malicious code acts as a remote access trojan (RAT), allowing attackers to execute commands and hijack systems.

item.title: Malicious npm packages posing as utilities delete project directories
item.description: Vulnerable Product: npm JavaScript package index; CVE(s): None; Summary: Two malicious packages, 'express-api-sync' and 'system-health-sync-api', were discovered in the npm JavaScript package index. These packages posed as database syncing and system health monitoring tools but contained backdoors that enabled remote data-wiping actions at infected hosts.

item.title: Millions of low-cost Android devices turn home networks into crime platforms
item.description: A coordinated effort by Google and others disrupted a new malware campaign, BadBox 2.0, affecting over 1 million off-brand Android devices not certified under Play Protect. The FBI warned consumers to evaluate their IoT devices for signs of compromise, such as automatic connections to malicious app markets or requests to disable Play Protect.

item.title: ZDI-25-331: Autodesk Revit RFA File Parsing Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Autodesk Revit; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5036; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Autodesk Revit. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the parsing of RFA files due to a lack of validating the existence of an object prior to performing operations on it.

item.title: Microsoft shares script to restore inetpub folder you shouldn’t delete
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft; CVE(s): CVE-2025-21204, None; Summary: A high-severity Windows Process Activation privilege escalation vulnerability was mitigated by the creation of an empty "inetpub" folder. Removing this folder can make systems vulnerable again to the patched vulnerability.

item.title: Tax resolution firm Optima Tax Relief hit by ransomware, data leaked
item.description: The article reports on a Chaos ransomware attack against Optima Tax Relief, a US-based tax resolution firm. The attackers stole 69 GB of corporate and customer data, including sensitive personal information such as Social Security numbers, phone numbers, and home addresses.

item.title: New Rust-Developed InfoStealer Drains Sensitive Data from Chromium-Based Browsers
item.description: RustStealer is an information-stealing malware designed to extract sensitive data from Chromium-based browsers such as Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge. It uses advanced obfuscation techniques, exploits unencrypted data stored in browser profiles, and can exfiltrate data to remote command-and-control servers.

item.title: Hackers Leverage New ClickFix Tactic to Exploit Human Error with Deceptive Prompts
item.description: A sophisticated social engineering technique called ClickFix baiting has gained popularity among cybercriminals, targeting human end users as the weakest link in cybersecurity defenses. This method uses seemingly benign prompts to trick users into executing malicious commands, bypassing traditional security measures with ease. The attack chain involves spear phishing links, drive-by compromises, or fake CAPTCHA prompts that redirect users to malicious URLs, ultimately leading to the installation of malware families like XWorm, Lumma, and AsyncRAT.

item.title: New Atomic macOS Stealer Campaign Exploits ClickFix to Target Apple Users
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have detected a new malware campaign using the ClickFix social engineering tactic to distribute an information stealer malware, Atomic macOS Stealer (AMOS), on Apple macOS systems. The campaign leverages typosquat domains mimicking U.S.-based telecom provider Spectrum and tricks users into downloading the malware by serving malicious shell scripts designed to steal system passwords.

item.title: ZDI-25-326: (0Day) (Pwn2Own) WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger MCU Command Parsing Misinterpretation of Input Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5747; Summary: This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger devices. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the handling of command frames received by the MCU due to misinterpretation of input.

item.title: ZDI-25-327: (0Day) (Pwn2Own) WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger LAN OTA Exposed Dangerous Method Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger; CVE(s): ZDI-25-327, ZDI-CAN-26349, CVE-2025-5748; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote code execution on affected installations of WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger through the exposure of a method for uploading crafted software images to the Tuya communications module. Although authentication is required, the existing mechanism can be bypassed.

item.title: ZDI-25-328: (0Day) (Pwn2Own) WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger BLE Encryption Keys Uninitialized Variable Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5749; Summary: This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger devices without requiring authentication. The specific flaw exists within the handling of cryptographic keys used in vendor-specific encrypted communications, resulting from an uninitialized variable.

item.title: ZDI-25-329: (0Day) (Pwn2Own) WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger tuya_svc_devos_activate_result_parse Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5750; Summary: The vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations without authentication. It occurs due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data length prior to copying it to a fixed-length heap-based buffer.

item.title: Hundreds of Malicious GitHub Repos Targeting Novice Cybercriminals Traced to Single User
item.description: The article reports on a campaign involving over 140 GitHub repositories laced with malicious backdoors orchestrated by a single threat actor. The backdoors employ four distinct types of backdoors, including PreBuild event scripts in Visual Basic project files, Python scripts, screensaver (.scr) files disguised as solution files, and JavaScript payloads.

item.title: ZDI-25-330: (0Day) (Pwn2Own) WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger Management Card Hard-coded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5751; Summary: This vulnerability allows physically present attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of the WOLFBOX Level 2 EV Charger. The specific flaw exists within the handling of management cards, resulting from the lack of personalization of management cards.

item.title: ClickFix Attack Uses Fake Cloudflare Verification to Silently Deploy Malware
item.description: A newly identified social engineering attack called "ClickFix" leverages fake Cloudflare verification pages to trick users into executing malicious code. The attack exploits user familiarity with Cloudflare's CAPTCHA interface, bypassing traditional security filters and delivering payloads such as info-stealers or remote access trojans.

item.title: Kettering Health confirms Interlock ransomware behind cyberattack
item.description: The Interlock ransomware group breached Kettering Health's network and stole sensitive information, including patient data, in a May cyberattack. The gang has been associated with other attacks on healthcare organizations and has deployed a previously unknown remote access trojan (RAT) called NodeSnake.

item.title: DragonForce Ransomware Reportedly Compromised Over 120 Victims in the Past Year
item.description: DragonForce, a ransomware group, has claimed over 120 victims in the past year and is considered a critical threat to monitor in 2025. The group targets organizations across various industries using a calculated approach that includes exploiting vulnerabilities, phishing, credential stuffing, and leveraging legitimate tools for persistence and lateral movement.

item.title: Beware: Fake AI Business Tools Spreading Hidden Ransomware
item.description:
Cybercriminals are deploying ransomware through deceptive campaigns targeting small businesses that adopt artificial intelligence (AI) tools. Attackers create fake websites and software installers that mimic popular AI services, leading to the installation of malware such as CyberLock, Lucky_Gh0$t, or Numero, which can render systems unusable or demand payment in cryptocurrency.
FYSA: Cybercriminals are capitalizing on the AI boom by targeting small businesses with ransomware attacks, posing a dual risk of immediate system compromise and long-term damage to confidence in digital tools.

item.title: New PathWiper data wiper malware hits critical infrastructure in Ukraine
item.description: PathWiper is a newly discovered data wiper malware used in targeted attacks against critical infrastructure in Ukraine, aimed at disrupting operations. The payload was deployed through a legitimate endpoint administration tool and has similar functionality to HermeticWiper, previously deployed by the 'Sandworm' threat group.

item.title: Scattered Spider Hackers Target Tech Company Help-Desk Administrators
item.description: The Scattered Spider hacking group has launched a targeted campaign against help-desk administrators at major technology companies, using advanced social engineering techniques and APT methodologies to breach corporate defenses. The attackers leverage phishing, credential stuffing, and impersonation tactics to gain unauthorized access to critical systems, often exploiting human vulnerabilities as effectively as technical ones. This campaign highlights the importance of robust employee training, multi-factor authentication protocols, and continuous monitoring to detect anomalous behavior.

item.title: New Mirai Variant Exploits TBK DVR Flaw for Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: TBK DVR-4104 and DVR-4216 devices; CVE(s): CVE-2024-3721; Summary: A critical command injection vulnerability (CVE-2024-3721) in TBK DVR-4104 and DVR-4216 devices allows attackers to exploit unpatched firmware, deploy a modified Mirai variant designed for IoT device hijacking and DDoS operations, and execute ARM32 binaries.

item.title: Microsoft Unveils European Security Effort to Disrupt Cybercrime Networks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows NTFS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-24993; Summary: A critical heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the Windows NTFS allows attackers to execute arbitrary code with local user privileges by crafting malicious VHD files and mounting them. The exploit requires social engineering or misleading users into believing the file is safe, and successful exploitation can result in privilege escalation, system compromise, data exfiltration, service disruption, and lateral movement.

item.title: ViperSoftX Malware Used by Threat Actors to Steal Sensitive Information
item.description: ViperSoftX is a sophisticated PowerShell-based malware designed to infiltrate infected systems, execute remote commands, steal sensitive data, and target cryptocurrency-related information. It employs deceptive tactics, abuses Windows Task Scheduler, and communicates with C&C servers using HTTP headers.

item.title: Critical Fortinet flaws now exploited in Qilin ransomware attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet; CVE(s): CVE-2024-21762, CVE-2024-55591; Summary: The Qilin ransomware operation is exploiting two Fortinet vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-21762 and CVE-2024-55591) to bypass authentication on vulnerable devices and execute malicious code remotely.

item.title: Empower Users and Protect Against GenAI Data Loss
item.description: The article discusses the increasing use of generative AI tools in the enterprise setting, despite attempts to block public AI apps. Employees have found workarounds to access AI systems, which creates a "Shadow AI" blind spot for organizations.

item.title: Microsoft Helps CBI Dismantle Indian Call Centers Behind Japanese Tech Support Scam
item.description: India's Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has dismantled two illegal call centers engaged in a transnational tech support scam targeting Japanese citizens, arresting four individuals and seizing evidence. The scam involved advanced social engineering techniques and "technical subterfuge" to deceive victims into transferring funds.

item.title: U.S. Offers $10M Bounty for Information on RedLine Malware Creator
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability. Instead, it discusses the RedLine infostealer malware and its alleged developer, Maxim Alexandrovich Rudometov, who is being sought with a $10 million reward under the Rewards for Justice program. The article details the malware's features, including configuration and C2 communication, host profiling, data exfiltration, remote execution and persistence, and anti-analysis measures.

item.title: ANY.RUN Empowers Government Agencies with Real-Time Threat Detection
item.description: Government agencies worldwide are facing an unprecedented wave of cyberattacks, with attackers employing advanced tactics to breach critical infrastructure and steal sensitive data. The most prevalent attack vector remains phishing emails, with spoofed domains and malicious attachments being used to deliver malware such as FormBook.

item.title: Critical RCE Vulnerability in AWS Amplify Studio – PoC Now Public
item.description: Vulnerable Product: @aws-amplify/codegen-ui; CVE(s): CVE-2025-4318; Summary: The AWS Amplify codegen package contained a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability due to improper input validation in expression-binding logic. The flaw allowed attackers to inject malicious expressions into component JSON files, enabling arbitrary code execution on backend build systems.

item.title: Inside the Mind of the Adversary: Why More Security Leaders Are Selecting AEV
item.description: The article discusses Adversarial Exposure Validation (AEV), an advanced offense technology that simulates real-world attacker behaviors to identify vulnerabilities in an organization's defenses. AEV provides continuous and automated testing, allowing for more efficient prioritization and remediation of security issues. The technology is designed to mimic how attackers would exploit weaknesses, enabling organizations to build resilience against attacks and provide a stronger defense posture.

item.title: Blitz Malware: A Tale of Game Cheats and Code Repositories
item.description:
The article provides a detailed technical analysis of Blitz malware, which consists of two phases: the Blitz downloader and the Blitz bot. The malware was distributed through backdoored game cheats, and it abused Hugging Face to host C2 infrastructure. The author claims to have quit distributing the malware.
The article highlights the security risks associated with engaging in illegal software distribution, including cracked game cheats. It also provides information on how Palo Alto Networks customers can be better protected from Blitz malware through various security features and subscriptions.
In summary, this article is not discussing a vulnerability (software, hardware, or firmware), but rather providing threat intelligence and analysis of the Blitz malware.

item.title: Critical FreeRTOS-Plus-TCP Flaw Allows Code Execution or System Crash
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Amazon FreeRTOS-Plus-TCP; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5688; Summary: A critical memory corruption vulnerability exists in FreeRTOS-Plus-TCP due to the lack of adequate length checking when processing LLMNR and mDNS queries with excessively long DNS names. This can lead to system crashes or arbitrary code execution, making embedded systems a high-value target for attackers.

item.title: Chrome Extensions Flaw Exposes Sensitive API Keys, Secrets and Tokens
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Various Chrome Extensions; CVE(s): None; Summary: Numerous popular Chrome extensions contain a critical security flaw that exposes sensitive credentials such as API keys, secrets, and tokens in their source code, allowing attackers to exploit them and potentially cause data manipulation, financial losses, and privacy breaches.

item.title: Critical RCE Flaw Found in HPE Insight Remote Support Tool
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Hewlett-Packard Enterprise (HPE) Insight Remote Support; CVE(s): CVE-2025-37097, CVE-2025-37098, and CVE-2025-37099; Summary: Multiple high-impact vulnerabilities in HPE's Insight Remote Support (IRS) software allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code, traverse directories, and exfiltrate sensitive information. The flaws are due to directory traversal and XML external entity (XXE) injection in the IRS service's file upload mechanism and XML input processing during device registration. Successful exploitation can result in full remote code execution under the privileges of the IRS service.

item.title: Police arrests 20 suspects for distributing child sexual abuse content
item.description: Law enforcement authorities from over a dozen countries have arrested 20 suspects in an international operation targeting the production and distribution of child sexual abuse material. The operation, which started in late 2024, involved multiple instant messaging groups dedicated to the circulation of child sexual exploitation images. Additionally, another joint international investigation led by the State Criminal Police of Bavaria and Bavarian cybercrime prosecutors took down Kidflix, one of the largest child sexual abuse material platforms on the dark web.

item.title: New pathWiper Malware Targets Critical Infrastructure to Deploy Admin Tools
item.description: This article reports a sophisticated cyberattack targeting Ukrainian critical infrastructure, deploying a previously unknown wiper malware dubbed "PathWiper." The attack is attributed to a Russia-nexus advanced persistent threat (APT) actor and showcases the evolving threat to Ukrainian critical infrastructure amid the ongoing conflict.

item.title: New PathWiper Data Wiper Malware Disrupts Ukrainian Critical Infrastructure in 2025 Attack
item.description:
